revised_title: Observations on the Freezing Resistance of Egg Albumen
tldr: The author's experiments confirm that fresh eggs resist freezing longer than others due to a unique property of their albumen. This property allows the albumen's temperature to be reduced without freezing, protecting the eggs' ability to develop. The author also found that intense cold without freezing does not affect egg development.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
